__e: It's like everything I put together, it was all gone in one night.
Told his wife he was going away on a business trip and he never arrived.
She said she was going on a boat trip but she didn't say where.
And only now did it dawn on me that there was a war somewhere and that my wife was leaving me for that war. and that my wife was leaving me for that war.
Well the how's pretty self-explanatory, and the why is because, hic, I thought we were leaving at six a.m.
But whenever we went away, the first night back he always used to say you can't beat your own bed.
All I wanted was for Matty to knock on that door, to tell me that he wasn't leaving and that it wasn't unfair of me to want that.
And that if he didn't go, then I would, because I couldn't stand to watch what we were doing to him anymore.
Yep, I was a happy man.
Isn't it suspicious? He came without a tie, and now he is swaggering in my spatter dashes?
I just... I just remember when I was 12 and sneaking out with my older brother.
She sent one letter in which she wrote.... ...that she was in love with some guy and ran off with him.
Last time I saw him, he was headed out to have a threesome.
He said he was going to go help my mother but he didn't come back, and neither did she.
Stop being hard-headed and let's go! Why you yelling? I'm waiting for Dante, and that's it.
Well, my ticket agent said it was Departure Gate B.
That's why I didn't try to make bail and why I was leaving town at the last minute...
I knew he was leaving anyway, but it didn't make a difference.
